Managers API Reference

This section documents the manager classes that handle configuration, logging, path resolution, and progress tracking.

Configuration Manager

class utils.manager.config_manager.ConfigManager(config: Dict, config_path: str | None = None, project_base: str | Path | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Manages configuration for the RMI 360 Imaging Workflow Toolbox.

This class loads YAML configuration, validates its schema, and exposes helper methods for retrieving nested keys, resolving expressions, and integrating with logging and path management. Intended for consistent environment setup across tools.

_config

The parsed configuration dictionary.

Type:

dict

_config_path

Path to the loaded config file.

Type:

str

_project_base

Project root directory for resolving outputs.

Type:

Path

_paths

Path manager instance for resolving file paths.

Type:

PathManager

_lm

Logger instance for logging messages.

Type:

LogManager

Typical usage:

cfg = ConfigManager.from_file(“path/to/config.yaml”, project_base) cfg.validate(tool=”enhance”) log = cfg.get_logger() path = cfg.paths.logs

__init__(config: Dict, config_path: str | None = None, project_base: str | Path | None = None)[source]

Initialize ConfigManager from a parsed config dictionary.

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – Parsed YAML configuration.

  • config_path (str, optional) – Path to the loaded config file.

  • project_base (str or Path, optional) – Project root directory for resolving outputs.

classmethod from_file(path: str | None = None, project_base: str | Path | None = None, *, messages: list | None = None) → ConfigManager[source]
validate(tool: str | None = None) → None[source]

Run schema validation on the config, optionally scoped to a tool.

Validates the configuration against the expected schema. If a tool name is provided, only the configuration for that specific tool is validated. Otherwise, the entire configuration is validated.

Parameters:

tool (str, optional) – Name of the tool section to validate (e.g., “enhance_images”).

Raises:

ValueError – If the configuration fails validation.

has_section(section: str) → bool[source]

Check if a specific section exists in the configuration.

Parameters:

section (str) – The top-level section name to check for.

Returns:

True if the section exists, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Examples

cfg.has_section(“logs”)

True

cfg.has_section(“nonexistent_section”)

False

get_sections() → List[str][source]

Get a list of all top-level sections in the configuration.

Returns:

List of section names that are dictionaries.

Return type:

List[str]

Examples

cfg.get_sections()

[‘logs’, ‘project’, ‘camera’, ‘camera_offset’, ‘spatial_ref’, ‘executables’, …]

get(key_path: str, default: Any = None) → Any[source]

Access a nested config key using dot notation.

Traverses the configuration dictionary using the dot-separated key path. Returns the default value if any part of the path is not found.

Parameters:

  • key_path (str) – Dot-separated key path, e.g., ‘logs.process_log’.

  • default (Any) – Value to return if key is not found.

Returns:

Retrieved value or default if the key path doesn’t exist.

Return type:

Any

Examples

cfg.get(“logs.process_log”)

“process_log.txt”

cfg.get(“nonexistent.key”, “fallback”)

“fallback”

resolve(expr: str | int | float, row: Dict | None = None) → Any[source]

Resolve an expression string using config and optional row context.

Parameters:

  • expr (str|int|float) – Expression to resolve.

  • row (dict, optional) – Row context for field substitution.

Returns:

Resolved expression value.

Return type:

Any

property raw: dict

Return the full raw config dictionary.

Returns:

The raw parsed configuration.

Return type:

dict

property source_path: str | None

Returns the file path from which the config was loaded.

Returns:

Absolute path to config file or None if unknown.

Return type:

str or None

property paths: PathManager
get_logger(messages: list | None = None) → LogManager[source]
get_progressor(total: int, label: str = 'Processing...', step: int = 1) → ProgressorManager[source]
TOOL_VALIDATORS = {'add_images_to_oid': <function validate>, 'apply_exif_metadata': <function validate>, 'assign_group_index': <function validate>, 'build_oid_footprints': <function validate>, 'build_oid_schema': <function validate>, 'calculate_oid_attributes': <function validate>, 'copy_to_aws': <function validate>, 'correct_gps_outliers': <function validate>, 'create_oriented_imagery_dataset': <function validate>, 'deploy_lambda_monitor': <function validate>, 'enhance_images': <function validate>, 'generate_oid_service': <function validate>, 'geocode_images': <function validate>, 'mosaic_processor': <function validate>, 'rename_images': <function validate>, 'smooth_gps_noise': <function validate>, 'update_linear_and_custom': <function validate>}
validate_tool_config(tool: str)[source]

Validates the configuration for a specified tool using its registered validator.

If the tool name is not recognized, logs an error and signals a configuration validation failure.

Parameters:

tool – The name of the tool whose configuration should be validated.

Raises:

ConfigValidationError – If the tool name is not registered.

Path Manager

class utils.manager.path_manager.PathManager(project_base: Path, config: dict | ConfigManager = None, script_base: Path = None)[source]

Bases: object

Central path manager for RMI 360 Workflow.

Resolves all paths related to: - 🗂 Script structure (configs/, templates/, lambdas/) - 📁 Project outputs (logs/, backups/, panos/, renamed/) - 🧩 Schema components (GDBs, registries) - 🔧 Executables (ExifTool, Mosaic Processor)

Supports config overrides, expression-based log prefixes, and runtime executable checks.

__init__(project_base: Path, config: dict | ConfigManager = None, script_base: Path = None)[source]

Initialize the PathManager.

Parameters:

  • project_base (Path) – The base path of the active project.

  • config (dict or ConfigManager, optional) – The loaded configuration, either raw or wrapped.

  • script_base (Path, optional) – The root folder where rmi_360_workflow.pyt lives. Defaults to the parent of the calling file’s parent.

property templates

Path to template directory (configurable via oid_schema_template.template.templates_dir).

property configs

Path to configs directory under script base.

property lambdas

Path to aws_lambdas directory under script base.

property primary_config_path

Returns the path to config.yaml under script base.

property fallback_config_path

Returns the path to config.sample.yaml under script base.

property backups

Path to project backups folder (configurable via orchestrator.backup_folder).

property backup_gdb

Path to project backup fgdb (configurable via orchestrator.oid_backup_fgdb).

property logs

Path to logs folder (configurable via logs.path).

property report

Path to reports folder (configurable via logs.report_path).

property panos

Path to the base panos folder (configurable via image_output.folders.parent).

property original

Path to the original images folder (configurable via image_output.folders.original).

property enhanced

Path to the enhanced images folder (configurable via image_output.folders.enhanced).

property renamed

Path to the renamed/final images folder (configurable via image_output.folders.renamed).

property oid_field_registry

Path to the ESRI OID field registry YAML (from oid_schema_template.esri_default.field_registry).

property oid_schema_gdb

Path to the OID schema GDB (inside templates dir, resolved from config).

property oid_schema_template_name: str

Returns the configured name of the OID schema template table/feature class.

property oid_schema_template_path: str

Returns the configured path of the OID schema template table/feature class.

property geoloc500_config_path

Resolved geolocation500 config path from config (relative to script base).

property geocustom_config_path

Resolved geocustom config path from config (relative to script base).

property exiftool_exe

‘exiftool’).

Type:

Path to ExifTool executable (default

property mosaic_processor_exe

Path to Mosaic Processor executable (no default).

property mosaic_processor_grp

Returns the resolved path to the Mosaic GRP calibration file, if configured. Returns None if unset or misconfigured.

property mosaic_processor_cfg

Path to Mosaic Processor config file (no default).

property lambda_pm_path

Path to the lambda_progress_monitor.py.

property lambda_dr_path

Path to the disable_rule.py.

get_log_file_path(log_key: str, cfg: 'ConfigManager' | None = None) → Path[source]
validate_mosaic_config(messages: List | None = None, config: dict | None = None, log_func: callable | None = None) → bool[source]

Validates mosaic processor configuration and logs any errors found.

Checks if the mosaic processor executable and GRP calibration file are properly configured and accessible. Logs errors through the provided log_func if issues are found.

Parameters:

  • messages (List, optional) – ArcGIS message object for logging. Defaults to None.

  • config (dict, optional) – Config dict for contextual logging. Defaults to None.

  • log_func (callable, optional) – Logging function that accepts (message, messages, level, config). Defaults to None.

Returns:

True if configuration is valid, False if any issues were found

Return type:

bool

check_exiftool_available() → bool[source]

Checks if ExifTool is available and runnable.

Tests if the ExifTool executable configured in executables.exiftool.exe_path can be run successfully. Uses _is_executable_available with default arguments.

Returns:

True if ExifTool is available and runs without error, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

check_mosaic_processor_available() → bool[source]

Checks if Mosaic Processor is available and runnable.

Tests if the Mosaic Processor executable configured in executables.mosaic_processor.exe_path can be run successfully. Uses _is_executable_available with default arguments.

Returns:

True if Mosaic Processor is available and runs without error, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

classmethod from_config_file(config_path: Path, project_base: Path, script_base: Path = None) → PathManager[source]

Load configuration from a YAML file and initialize a PathManager.

Parameters:

  • config_path (Path) – Path to the YAML config file.

  • project_base (Path) – The base path of the project.

  • script_base (Path, optional) – Override script base.

Returns:

Initialized instance with config loaded from the specified file.

Return type:

PathManager

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the config file doesn’t exist.

  • yaml.YAMLError – If the config file contains invalid YAML.

Log Manager

class utils.manager.log_manager.LogManager(messages=None, config: dict | None = None, path_manager: PathManager | None = None, enable_file_output: bool = True)[source]

Bases: object

LogManager provides structured logging for command-line, ArcGIS, and web-based workflows.

Logs are collected in plain text, HTML, and JSON formats with support for: - Multiple log levels (info, warning, error, debug) - Step-based indentation and timing - Context metadata (tool, file, reel, etc.) - ArcGIS Pro messaging (if a message object is provided) - Export to .txt, .html, and .json files via PathManager

Designed for use in orchestration scripts, CLI tools, and ArcGIS Python Toolbox tools.

LEVEL_PREFIX = {'custom': '', 'debug': '🛠️', 'error': '❌', 'info': 'ℹ️', 'success': '✅', 'warning': '⚠️'}
SHOW_INDENT_LEVEL_IN_DEBUG = True
SHOW_CONTEXT_IN_DEBUG = False
__init__(messages=None, config: dict | None = None, path_manager: PathManager | None = None, enable_file_output: bool = True)[source]

Initialize the LogManager.

Parameters:

  • messages (optional) – ArcPy messaging object for integrated tool messages.

  • config (dict, optional) – Project-level configuration, including debug flag.

  • path_manager (PathManager, optional) – Provides log file directories.

  • enable_file_output (bool) – If True, log to .txt, .html, and .json files.

log(msg: str, level: str = 'info', context: Dict | None = None, indent: int = 0, error_type: Type[Exception] | None = None, emoji: str | None = None) → None[source]

Log a message with a specified level, optional context, and explicit indentation.

Parameters:

  • msg (str) – The message to log.

  • level (str) – Logging level. One of ‘debug’, ‘info’, ‘warning’, ‘error’, ‘success’, or ‘custom’.

  • context (dict, optional) – Metadata context to include in the log (default: None).

  • indent (int, optional) – Indentation level (number of indent units, default: 0).

  • error_type (Type[Exception], optional) – Exception type to raise if level is ‘error’ (default: None).

  • emoji (str, optional) – Emoji to use for ‘custom’ level messages (default: None).

For ‘custom’ level, provide an emoji. For ‘error’, if error_type is given, raises after logging (indent forced to 0 unless overridden).

debug(msg: str, context: Dict | None = None, indent: int = 0) → None[source]
info(msg: str, context: Dict | None = None, indent: int = 0) → None[source]
warning(msg: str, context: Dict | None = None, indent: int = 0) → None[source]
error(msg: str, context: Dict | None = None, indent: int = 0, error_type: Type[Exception] | None = None) → None[source]
success(msg: str, context: Dict | None = None, indent: int = 0) → None[source]
custom(msg: str, emoji: str, context: Dict | None = None, indent: int = 0) → None[source]
get_messages() → List[str][source]
export_txt(filename: str = 'process_log.txt') → None[source]

Export plain text log to .txt file.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Output filename for the text log.

export_json(filename: str = 'process_log.json') → None[source]

Export log records to a structured JSON file.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Filename for the JSON export.

export_html(filename: str | None = 'process_log.html') → None[source]

Export log output to an HTML file with collapsible blocks.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Output filename for the HTML log.

export_all(basename: str = 'process_log') → None[source]

Export log to .txt, .html, and .json using a common base filename.

step(msg: str, context: Dict | None = None)[source]

Context manager for logging the start and end of a logical step. Logs separators before and after the step message at indent=0. Any log messages inside should use indent=1 for proper nesting. Usage:

with logger.step(“Run Mosaic Processor”):

logger.info(“Hello”, indent=1)

Progress Manager

class utils.manager.progressor_manager.ProgressorManager(total: int, label: str = 'Processing...', step: int = 1, log_manager: LogManager | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

__init__(total: int, label: str = 'Processing...', step: int = 1, log_manager: LogManager | None = None)[source]

Initializes a Progressor instance for tracking and reporting progress.

Parameters:

  • total – The total number of steps to track.

  • label – The label to display for the progressor.

  • step – The increment value for each progress update.

  • log_manager – Optional LogManager instance for logging errors.

__enter__()[source]

Initializes the ArcGIS Pro progressor if possible when entering the context.

If initialization fails or the total is not positive, disables ArcGIS progressor usage and falls back to CLI output.

Returns:

The ProgressorManager instance.

update(pos: int, label: str | None = None)[source]

Updates the progress display to the specified position, optionally updating the label.

If the ArcGIS progressor is active, updates its label and position; otherwise, prints progress to the console as a percentage.

__exit__(exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb)[source]

Cleans up progress reporting resources when exiting the context.

If the ArcGIS progressor was used, attempts to reset it; otherwise, ensures CLI output formatting by printing a newline.
